channel.title: Python?
channel.description: Hi, I would like to start learning Python or C+, what site do I need to visit to learn either?

item.title: Python?
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

[quote=“fellixombc, post:13, topic:298078”]http://docs.python.org/tutorial/

and honestly, if you get bored, just google some tutorials. My first python app was an irc bot, which was called FellixBot, and did O.K but not super well. Also: Cowie is a great resource.[/quote]

Already went there, and thanks all of you.

Read full topic

and honestly, if you get bored, just google some tutorials. My first python app was an irc bot, which was called FellixBot, and did O.K but not super well. Also: Cowie is a great resource.

item.title: Python?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Cowie`:

I looked at Panda3d a while ago when you shew me a game you wrote on IRC and it looked vile.

If it is the game I am thinking about it was because it was a 2d game written with a 3d game engine, kinda hacky.

Read full topic

item.title: Python?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Unhandled:

Python-OGRE is a binding on top of the C++ version, so it’s quite fast.

Same with Panda3d, you can use it with C++ too if you want, but there are many commercial games already using it that use python.

Read full topic

item.title: Python?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

I can’t say I’ve used Panda3d, but OGRE is some top notch stuff.
Python-OGRE is a binding on top of the C++ version, so it’s quite fast.

Read full topic

item.title: Python?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“xpatx, post:7, topic:298078”][quote author=Cowie` link=topic=394488.msg2932588#msg2932588 date=1251363673]

if you want to make games look into panda3d, it’s an awesome game engine that is easy to use and makes great games.

Ignore what this man says, get python-ogre.
[/quote]

Haha, I just downloaded Python-Ogre and looked through the example files they provide you. It seems they did a great job with the examples :p. Listen to Cowie`, use Python-Ogre.[/quote]

Panda3d has many examples too, which are included in the download. Whenever I get around to packaging it up I’m going to post an awesome game I wrote with panda3d complete with a level editor and everything.

Read full topic

item.title: Python?

if you want to make games look into panda3d, it’s an awesome game engine that is easy to use and makes great games.
[/quote]

Ignore what this man says, get python-ogre.[/quote]

Haha, I just downloaded Python-Ogre and looked through the example files they provide you. It seems they did a great job with the examples :p. Listen to Cowie`, use Python-Ogre.

item.title: Python?
item.dc:creator: @Explisionist Explisionist
item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Python is awesome. I would just google for python examples, if you want to make games look into panda3d, it’s an awesome game engine that is easy to use and makes great games.

Thanks, you always have an answer for these type of question’s. I’m gonna bookmark some pages and tomorrow I will start doing it, hopefully get some good stuff going.

Read full topic
